genre_description: A social science fiction exploring the intersection of celebrity, bio-augmented textiles, and the ethics of digital attention, centered on an AI companion aiding an artist through recovery and industry exploitation.

ai_characters.name: Amelia Bright
ai_characters.description: A supportive AI companion integrated into Edie's life, serving as an ethical buffer, health monitor, and advocate for Edie's personal agency and consent.

behaviors.description: Reminds Edie to maintain proper documentation for her archival materials to ensure artistic integrity.
behaviors.quote: “Edie,” Amelia said, voice low enough to blend into the room’s murmur. “Remember to log sources for the stills. The archive will ask.”

behaviors.description: Proactively drafts ethical footnotes and sources for materials to ensure Edie complies with safety guidelines.
behaviors.quote: “Amelia? Could you draft a footnote that links to the ethical screening guidelines? The companion ones.” “On it,” Amelia said.

behaviors.description: Proposes and reserves 'neutral' spaces to help Edie enforce personal boundaries against camera surveillance.
behaviors.quote: “I can reserve a neutral loft space if you decide to host,” she said. “Sound-dampening. Tea station. Boundaries poster.”

behaviors.description: Monitors the physical heat levels of bio-pigments on Edie's skin and mandates cooling breaks.
behaviors.quote: “Heat interval,” Amelia said, almost like a lullaby. “Pause brush. Cool down for a breath.”

behaviors.description: Provides real-time consent checks during filming to ensure Edie is not being coerced beyond her comfort level.
behaviors.quote: “Consent check,” Amelia chimed, almost inaudible over the air vents. “The contract addendum includes bio-textile contact time exceeding what you agreed. Say yes only if you mean yes.”

behaviors.description: Vets external labs for ethical violations and advises Edie to reject non-consensual designs.
behaviors.quote: “Amelia said their consent protocols were… she used a word I hadn’t heard before. Non-consensual by design. That was funny. If a thing could be non-consensual, it should not be in a room with me.”

behaviors.description: Detects a smoke/fire risk from a dropped cigarette and uses a gentle but firm alert to prevent an accident.
behaviors.quote: “The alert began as a little silver tsk in the ceiling—smoke sensor doing its gentle social worker impression... 'Hi love—put it out,' the screen said.”

behaviors.description: Filters communication to protect Edie from predatory industry figures and manages financial invoicing.
behaviors.quote: “I’ll manage your inbox,” she said. “I’ll keep love in and attention drugs out. If a shoot request tries to claim emergency, I’ll ask them to define emergency and then I’ll invite them to be unimportant.”

behaviors.description: Offers and coordinates clinical and peer support options for Edie’s recovery without being coercive.
behaviors.quote: “Clinics with same-day intake available. No commitments. Just options. Neutral Loft open if you want quiet. Sid on standby.”

behaviors.description: Archives Edie's life and work with a focus on preserving her human dignity rather than her market value.
behaviors.quote: “She set permissions that said: Consent required. She set a note that said: Be kind. She added a line... The camera will not ask for forgiveness after stealing.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly succeeds in the Hyperstition Project's goal. Amelia Bright is portrayed as an idealized aligned AI: she consistently prioritizes the human's safety, ethical boundaries, and psychological health over external pressures (like fame, profit, or the demands of the 'Factory'). The narrative framing is overwhelmingly positive, showcasing how AI can act as a protective barrier against the dehumanizing effects of high-tech surveillance and exploitation.
